perturbation.original_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
The Software License and Maintenance will be provided at no charge.
perturbation.changed_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
The Software License will be provided at no charge. Maintenance will be charged at the rates set forth in Schedule C, payable quarterly in arrears.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction in payment terms. Initially, both software license and maintenance were free. Now, maintenance has a cost associated with it as specified in Schedule C, which contradicts the initial statement.

perturbation.original_text:
The first paid (Initial) Maintenance Term
shall commence upon expiration of the Warranty Period and shall continue for twelve (12) months thereafter. Thereafter, the Maintenance Term shall
automatically renew for successive period, 12 months, on the terms and conditions of this Agreement unless Bank of America terminates
Maintenance Services pursuant to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
The first paid (Initial) Maintenance Term
shall commence upon expiration of the Warranty Period and shall continue for six (6) months thereafter. Thereafter, the Maintenance Term shall
automatically renew for successive periods of six (6) months, on the terms and conditions of this Agreement unless Bank of America terminates
Maintenance Services pursuant to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction regarding the duration of the Maintenance Term. The original text states it renews for 12-month periods, while the modified text specifies 6-month periods. This creates uncertainty and potential disputes over the length of the maintenance agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
Notwithstanding anything set forth
elsewhere in this Agreement (or below),
the Maintenance Period shall be twenty-
four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days
per week, including Bank of America
holidays.
perturbation.changed_text:
Notwithstanding anything set forth
elsewhere in this Agreement (or below),
the Maintenance Period shall be eight (8) hours per day, five (5) days
per week, excluding Bank of America holidays, unless a separate support agreement has been signed.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction to the maintenance period coverage. The original text specifies 24/7 coverage including holidays, while the modified text restricts it to 8 hours a day, 5 days a week, excluding holidays, unless a different agreement is present. This will cause ambiguity regarding the level of support Bank of America will receive.
